mcm.utils
Class Trace

java.lang.Object
  mcm.utils.Trace

public class Trace
extends java.lang.Object

Trace offers various printing methods that can be (de-)activated at runtime. Some methods prefix output lines with information about the currently executing thread and the current time, given in milliseconds.

Author:
Monika Mevenkamp

Field Detail

global

public static Trace global
Globally available Trace instance that is initialized to use System.err as its output stream. Its trace level is set to zero, its traceThreadNames and traceTime modes are set to false. Thus unless its trace level is changed calls to trace and traceln will not produce any output.

Constructor Detail

Trace

public Trace()
Allocates a new Trace object. This constructor has the same effect as Trace(System.err)

Trace

public Trace(java.io.PrintStream out)
Allocates a new Trace object. The new Trace object uses the given stream as output stream and has a trace level of zero.

Parameters:
out - the PrintStreem used for output

Trace

public Trace(java.lang.String fname)
Allocates a new Trace object. The new Trace object has a trace level of zero. The constructor creates a PrintStream for the given file name and assigns it as output stream. If it can't create the PrintStream it prints an error message and assigns System.err as output stream.

Method Detail

report

public static void report(java.lang.Exception e)
Prints the given exception's stack trace to global as well as System.err. If global's output stream is System.err it prints the exception only once.

Parameters:
e - exception whose stack trace is printed
See Also:
global

report

public static void report(java.lang.String message)
Prints the given message to global as well as System.err. If global's output stream is System.err it prints the message only once.

Parameters:
message - the message
See Also:
global

setOptions

public void setOptions(Trace tracer)
Assume the same tracing options as the given parameter.

Parameters:
tracer - Trace instance whose options are copied

doTrace

public boolean doTrace()
The same as doTraceLevel(0);

Returns:
true if the trace level is greater 0; false otherwise

doTraceLevel

public boolean doTraceLevel(int lvl)
Determines whether messages should be printed given a trace level of lvl.

Returns:
true if this Trace's trace level is greater lvl; false otherwise

doTraceThreadNames

public boolean doTraceThreadNames()
Returns this Trace objects traceThreadNames mode.

Returns:
true if output is prefixed with the name of the current thread; false otherwise.

doTraceTime

public boolean doTraceTime()
Returns this Trace object's traceTime mode.

Returns:
the value of this Trace object'ss traceTime mode

getStream

public java.io.PrintStream getStream()
Returns the print stream used for output messages.

getTraceLevel

public int getTraceLevel()
Returns this Trace's trace level value. The trace level value governs which messages are actually send to the output stream by the trace and traceln methods. The higher the level the more traces are printed.

Returns:
the global trace level value

print

public void print(java.lang.String s)
Prints and flushes the given string to its output stream.

Parameters:
s - the message to be printed

println

public void println()
The same as calling println("");

println

public void println(java.lang.String s)
Prints and flushes the given string followed by a newline character to its output stream. If this trace object's traceTime is set to true it prefixes the line with the current time measured in milliseconds. It this Trace object's traceThreadNames mode is true it prefixes output with the name of the currently exceuting thread.

Parameters:
s - the message to be printed

printMsg

public void printMsg(java.lang.Object o,
                     java.lang.String msg)
The same as calling println(o + ":: " + msg);

Parameters:
o - any non null object
msg - any non null String message

setTraceLevel

public void setTraceLevel(int doTrace)
Sets this Trace's trace level value to the given number. The trace level value governs which messages are actually send to the output stream by trace and traceln methods as well as the result of doTrace and doTraceLevel method calls.

Parameters:
doTrace - the new trace level

setTraceThreadNames

public void setTraceThreadNames(boolean traceThreadNames)
Sets this Trace's traceThreadNames mode. traceln and println methods prefix output with the name of the currently executing thread while the traceThreadNames mode is true.

Parameters:
traceThreadNames - the new traceThreadNames mode.

setTraceTime

public void setTraceTime(boolean traceTime)
Sets this Trace's traceTime mode. traceln and println methods prefix output with the current time while the traceTime mode is true.

Parameters:
traceTime - the new traceTime mode.

trace

public void trace(java.lang.String s)
Prints and flushes the given string to the output stream if its trace level is greater zero.

Parameters:
s - the string to be printed if trace level > 0

traceln

public void traceln()
Same as traceln("");

traceln

public void traceln(java.lang.String s)
Prints to its output stream if its trace level is greater zero. If it does print it adds a new line character after the given string.

Parameters:
s - the string to be printed if trace level > 0

traceMsg

public void traceMsg(java.lang.Object o,
                     java.lang.String msg)
Calls printMsg(o, msg) if its trace level is greater zero.

Parameters:
o - any object
msg - any String
